Recursion: Recursion in computer science is a method where the solution to a problem depends on solutions to smaller instances of the same problem (as opposed to iteration).
Bactracking: Backtracking is a general algorithm for finding all (or some) solutions to some computational problems, notably constraint satisfaction problems, that incrementally builds candidates to the solutions, and abandons each partial candidate c (backtracks) as soon as it determines that c cannot possibly be completed to a valid solution.

files.string_permutations: Given a string of length n find all the n! permutations of the string
